nodes.text: The Nightsisters, a group of Force-sensitive women who lived on the planet Dathomir, wore a type of armor. Consisting of a distinctive metal breastplate, the personal armor  was used as bodily protection. Such breastplates were segmented and secured by laces attached at the back. It was often worn in conjunction with a black grafiform robe and a feathered cape. Sister Charal, a Nightsister who was stranded on the Forest Moon of Endor about a century before the Galactic Civil War, wore such a set of armor.
The armor first appeared in the 1985 television film Ewoks: The Battle for Endor. Its design was developed by director and artist Joe Johnston.
In the 2003 Sony Online Entertainment massively multiplayer online role-playing game, Star Wars Galaxies, Charal's armor was depicted as a single plate of metal adorned with mystical carvings.
